g.text: - Update an instance of SaC following a new release
Go to your cloned copy of your dedicated instance of SaC

a.title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab
a.xlink:title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab

g.text: Get the updated version of SaC from the

a.title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab
a.xlink:title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab

g.text: Update the homepage value in the package.json file with the (case sensitive) address of your new repository
The base url for generated site needs to be set correctly for your missions and sequences to render.
Find and replace all references to the

a.title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab
a.xlink:title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab

g.text: with the address of your instance of the repository
You can ignore the references in the sample uml and svg files as you presumably will be replacing those files.
Open a terminal session, go to your local folder and run
This is to install any new or updated dependencies in the local node_modules folder
Remove the sample mission and sequence, entitled Your mission, provided with the new release of the

a.title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab
a.xlink:title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab

g.text: Delete the entry for yourmission from missions.json.
Delete the associated images/yourmission.svg and uml/yourmission.uml files from the sequences/yourmission folder.
Re configure your missions and sequences in missions.json.
Re add your sequence uml and svg files to the appropriate sequences sub-folder.
Remember to update any unit tests that need to be updated
Verify your site is up and running. It should be available at

a.title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab
a.xlink:title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab

g.text: Remember to update any unit tests that need to be updated
Verify your site is up and running. It should be available at

a.title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab
a.xlink:title: Right click to open in a new window or a new tab
